content: start of the row re-join the yarn to the remaining 40 stitches and cast off in pattern starting with a sl 1 pwise wyif and ending with a k1 this is what your finished piece of knitting should look like now you can use those cast off tails of yarn to sew the ends of the handles down to the other side of the bag the straight sides of each handle should be close together but there should be a small gap between the shaped edges of the two handles to match the first side match the cast off edges with start of same handle and fold the bag with the straight edges of the handles at the sides mark the position of the shaped edge on the bag so that you know where to sew to or from sew through the cast off edges taking your stitches through the edge of the thick knitted fabric 6 finally darn in the rest of the yarn tails tidying up any unevenness as you go you can leave your bag like this or add a covered lining if you d prefer a flat base the base can be made of cardboard buckram or plastic canvas whichever you use i d recommend working out the size you need with some thin card first and then using that as a template for this bag i used a 4¼ plastic canvas circle and then cut it down by two rings to give me a circle that was a bit under 4 i found that the base looked better if it was just a bit smaller than the base of the bag covering the base the cover for the base is knitted in the round on a 3 25 mm needle in much the same way as the base of the bag using the long tail method cast on eight stitches and follow the pattern for the base of the bag until your circle is as big as your chosen base this will probably be the full 16 rounds of the base pattern now knit two rounds without shaping to get round the edge of your circle and then start decreasing 7 round 1 and all odd numbered rounds knit round 2 k2tog k8 x 8 72 sts round 4 k2tog k7 x 8 64 sts round 4 k2tog k6 x 8 56 sts round 6 k2tog k5 x 8 48 sts round 8 k2tog k4 x 8 40 sts cast off knitwise using a 4 mm / us size 6 needle i stretched the base over the plastic circle and then gathered the cast on edge to make it lie a bit flatter you can just put the finished base in your bag but as you might know i never miss an opportunity to add buttons to my projects … i sewed this lovely big button right through the bottom of the bag and through the middle of the plastic circle a few times so
